reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Sweden's most famous Valborg celebration (April 30th/May 1st) in Uppsala, renowned for its unique student traditions like river rafting, cap-donning ceremonies, concerts, and bonfires.
May typically offers milder temperatures (average highs 15-17°C/59-63°F), increasing sunshine, and very long daylight hours, ideal for exploring the city and its surroundings.

See Uppsala's parks like Stadsträdgården and the Botanical Garden (Botaniska trädgården) burst into color with spring flowers and blossoming trees. The banks of the Fyrisån river become lush and scenic.
The presence of Uppsala University lends a youthful energy. May often features student events and concerts leading up to the end of the academic year.
Comfortable weather for visiting Uppsala Cathedral (Domkyrkan), Uppsala Castle (Slottet), Gustavianum museum, and the historic quarters without peak summer heat or crowds (outside of Valborg).
Ideal conditions for walking or cycling along the Fyrisån river, exploring nearby nature reserves (e.g., Lunsen), or potentially taking early boat trips on Lake Mälaren.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Walporgis (Apr 30/May 1) attracts immense crowds, predominantly students. Expect major disruptions, potential rowdiness, peak prices, fully booked accommodation, and closures on May 1st. It's a unique but intense experience.
Despite improving trends, May can still bring cool, rainy, or windy days. Packing layers, including rain gear, is essential.
Significant tree pollen (especially birch) is common in May and can be challenging for allergy sufferers.
Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelsfärdsdag), a public holiday, often falls in May (check dates). It creates a long weekend, leading to closures and increased domestic travel.
During Valborg, the city's atmosphere is heavily dominated by student celebrations, which might not appeal to all visitors seeking a quiet trip.

weather.precipitation: Sunshine increases, but expect cool nights/mornings. Moderate chance of rain showers and potentially windy conditions. Daylight hours are very long.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a medium jacket (waterproof recommended), comfortable walking shoes. Sunglasses useful. Allergy medication if needed.

tourism_level.crowds: Extremely high for Valborg (Apr 30/May 1), booking essential months in advance. Moderates significantly after May 1st but increases steadily.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak prices for Valborg weekend. Transitions to shoulder/high season rates afterwards.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Intense, chaotic, and festive during Valborg. Calms down significantly afterwards into a pleasant spring vibe.

events_holidays.name: Walpurgis Night (Valborgsmässoafton)
events_holidays.description: Uppsala's biggest event: Rafting on Fyrisån, herring lunch picnics, 'Mösspåtagning' (student cap-donning) at Carolina Rediviva, choir singing at Gunillaklockan (Castle), evening bonfires.
events_holidays.notes: Massive crowds, city center access restricted. Plan accommodation and travel far ahead. Expect significant alcohol consumption.

events_holidays.name: May Day / Labor Day (Första maj)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Much quieter than April 30th. Some remaining student activities, potential political marches.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread closures (most shops, Systembolaget, banks). Many services limited. Check museum/attraction opening status.

unique_experiences.where: City Center, Fyrisån River, Carolina Hill, Castle Hill
unique_experiences.description: Observe the unique student traditions of Uppsala's Valborg, like the chaotic river rafting or the formal cap-donning ceremony. (Primarily April 30th)
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Be prepared for extreme crowds and limited movement. Find viewing spots early. Less intense spots exist outside the absolute center.

unique_experiences.description: Explore Scandinavia's largest Gothic cathedral, the burial place of Swedish monarchs and notable figures like Carl Linnaeus. Quieter after the Valborg rush.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening times, especially around May 1st. Dress respectfully. Free entry.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a pleasant walk along the river that runs through the city center as spring foliage emerges.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Paths are flat and accessible. Many cafes and viewpoints along the way.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through Uppsala's main city park, enjoying the spring flowers, greenhouse (potentially), and open spaces.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good spot for a picnic on a nice day.

weather.precipitation: Often the most pleasant part of spring. Generally sunnier and warmer, though rain showers remain possible. Very long daylight.
weather.general_tips: Lighter layers are key, but keep a sweater or light jacket for evenings or cooler days. Sunscreen recommended for sunny spells.

tourism_level.crowds: High season approaching. Noticeably busier than early May (post-Valborg), particularly on weekends and if Ascension Day falls here.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Lovely late spring period. Ideal for sightseeing, exploring gardens, and enjoying the longer days before the main summer influx.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelsfärdsdag)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday in Sweden. Creates a long weekend for many.
events_holidays.notes: Check the date for the specific year. Expect closures (shops, banks). Increased travel within Sweden.

events_holidays.name: Potential University End-of-Term Events
events_holidays.description: Check Uppsala University schedules for public concerts, defenses, or other events as the semester winds down.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the grounds of the historic pink castle. Visit the Uppsala Art Museum (Konstmuseum) housed within.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours for the museum. The castle grounds offer great views over the city.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through the extensive university botanical garden, featuring Linnaeus's Orangery, tropical greenhouses, and diverse plant collections in bloom.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow ample time. Check opening hours for greenhouses. Free entry to outdoor gardens.

unique_experiences.activity: Day Trip to Gamla Uppsala (Old Uppsala)
unique_experiences.description: Visit the historically significant site with large Iron Age burial mounds, a museum (Gamla Uppsala Museum), and a medieval church.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Easily accessible by local bus (e.g., number 2) or a pleasant bike ride. The museum provides context for the mounds.

unique_experiences.description: Explore Uppsala University's oldest preserved building, famous for its unique Anatomical Theatre, plus collections related to science history, Egyptology, and classical antiquities.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours. Contains several distinct exhibitions.
